stories.story: I remember the morning I taught my daughter how to mend a fence after a storm. The field was muddy, and the posts were leaning, but we worked side by side, hands in the earth. I showed her how to brace the wood, how to check the wire, and we talked about the land—how it needs care, patience. By the time we finished, the sun was out, and she was smiling, proud of the work we’d done together. That’s the kind of day that stays with you.

There was a morning, years ago, when I fixed a fence with my daughter. The field was wet, and we worked together, setting posts and tightening wire. I remember teaching her, and how proud she looked when we finished.
I remember fixing a fence with my daughter. The ground was muddy. We worked together. She learned fast. It was a good day.
There was a day, a fence, my daughter. We worked. She smiled. I remember feeling proud.
